title: The Papers: Russia accused of genocide, and 'fuel duty cut'
description: Several of Monday's papers lead with Ukraine likening Vladimir Putin's actions to those of the Nazis.

title: WATCH: William and Kate dance in Belize
description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge are on a tour of the Caribbean.

title: William and Kate dance and taste chocolate during day two of Belize tour
description: "They were shaking their waists like nobody's business," said a local woman who danced with the duke.

title: War in Ukraine: Backlash in Russia against anti-war musicians
description: Banned from radio stations and rumoured black lists, artists against the war face a difficult moment.

title: In Mariupol, children bear the brunt of Vladimir Putin's war
description: At a children's hospital near the besieged city, the true impact of Russia's tactics are on display.

title: Money: £19bn in old UK banknotes and coins not cashed in
description: Paper £20 and £50 notes cannot be used after September this year but can still be exchanged.

title: I will help with costs where I can, says Chancellor Rishi Sunak
description: The chancellor says he will "stand by" people, as he faces pressure to act on rising living costs.

title: Sabita Thanwani killing: Manhunt continues over Clerkenwell death
description: Detectives want to speak to Maher Maaroufe, 22, following the death of 19-year-old Sabita Thanwani.

title: P&O Ferries' sackings were appalling, says Sunak
description: The government is examining the legality of the ferry firm's actions, the chancellor confirms.

title: Wirral marshland fire may have been started deliberately
description: Six fire appliances were sent to deal with the massive blaze on the Wirral Peninsula.

title: LeBron James becomes second all-time leading scorer but Los Angeles Lakers lose to Washington Wizards
description: LeBron James passes Karl Malone to become the NBA's second all-time leading scorer, despite the Los Angeles Lakers' loss to the Washington Wizards.

title: Ukraine war: Boris Johnson sparks fury after comparison to Brexit
description: Donald Tusk and Conservative peer Lord Barwell are among those criticising Boris Johnson's comments.

title: Six killed after car drives into crowd in Belgium
description: Several others are in a critical condition following the crash, which happened early on Sunday.

title: Ukraine conflict: Emotional reunion of Ukrainian sisters at UK airport
description: Iryna has been waiting anxiously to find out if her sister Olya and her family would make it to the UK.

title: William and Kate arrive in Belize for jubilee Caribbean tour
description: The couple were all smiles as they began their week-long tour celebrating the Platinum Jubilee.

title: England 'live to fight another day' after narrow win over New Zealand - bowler Cross
description: England "live to fight another day" in the Women's World Cup after their anxious one-wicket victory over New Zealand, according to Kate Cross.

title: Six Nations Grand Slam: France sweep fans off their feet with glorious triumph
description: A year out from a home World Cup, France's team, drawn from all parts of the country and society, revive memories of sporting triumphs past at the Stade de France.

title: Women's World Cup: England edge New Zealand in thrilling match
description: Watch highlights of England's nerve-shredding one-wicket win over New Zealand in a thrilling Women's Cricket World Cup match.

title: Ukraine war: North Moreton opens its arms to refugees
description: North Moreton, in Oxfordshire, is hoping to take in up to 60 people who have fled the war.

title: The Papers: Anger at Johnson comments, and hypersonic missile
description: Sunday's papers carry the PM's remarks comparing Ukraine's resistance to Britain leaving the EU.

title: Coronavirus: Spring booster offered to elderly and vulnerable in England
description: Up to five million elderly and vulnerable people will be eligible, with the first invites sent this week.

title: Anonymous: How hackers are trying to undermine Putin
description: The BBC speaks to hacktivists about past and future attacks in their "cyber war" against Vladimir Putin.

title: Women's World Cup: Heather Knight takes 'unbelievable' catch to remove Lea Tahuhu
description: England skipper Heather Knight takes a stunning one-handed catch to remove New Zealand's Lea Tahuhu at the Women's World Cup.

title: War in Ukraine: Anti-war opinions can cost Russians their jobs
description: The BBC hears from three people whose opposition to the war cost them their employment.

title: Ukraine war: Western agents seek to get inside Putin's head
description: Vladimir Putin's war in Ukraine shook the West. Now its leaders are trying to predict his next move.

title: 'I'm Australian but Ukraine is part of my identity'
description: Despite being half a world away, Ukrainian-Australians say the war feels unbearably close.

title: A specialty coffee wave is brewing in India
description: From Blue Tokai to Sleepy Owl, a new wave of homegrown coffee roasters are finding success in India.

title: Cobhams Asuquo: The Nigerian singer who hated his own voice
description: Cobhams Asuquo is now one of Nigeria's leading music figures but started his career behind the scenes.

title: How modern slavery victim went from homelessness to 'amazing' job
description: After years of being homeless, Will teamed up with a charity who helped him into employment.

title: Why are water bills rising more in some areas?
description: Experts say there are also big regional variations in the numbers of people receiving support.

title: Oscars: How Encanto composer Germaine Franco is smashing the glass ceiling
description: The Latina composer on breaking down barriers in Hollywood and landing an Oscar nomination.

title: Breakdancing changed my life
description: A dancer from Vietnam says breaking kept him away from drugs and helped him deal with family problems.

title: Muslim Hikers: 'What are 'proper walkers?''
description: More than 120 people walked in the Peak District as part of an event organised by the Muslim Hikers.

title: Sydney Harbour Bridge - the story of its opening 90 years ago
description: On its 90th anniversary, the grandson of the iconic bridge's designer reveals what he went through to get it built.
